00001 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00002 // Abstract:     This file contains the function xsvfExecute()
00003 //               used to to interpret the XSVF commands.
00004 // Usage:        Call xsvfExecute() to process XSVF data.
00005 //               The XSVF data is retrieved by ReadXSVF().
00006 //               ReadXSVF and portable JTAG low-level functions are declared,
00007 //               and probably defined as inline, in "xsvfPort.h" include file.
00008 // Debugging:    Define TRACE_XSVF <level> to compile with debugging features.
00009 // History:      v5.01 - Original XSVF implementation based on XAPP058
00010 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00011 
00012 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00013 // Debugging:
00014 //
00015 // #undef DEBUG_XSVF           // to disable verbose mode
00016 // #define DEBUG_XSVF <level>  // to enable verbose mode, where <level> is one of:
00017 //
00018 //    0 - Success/Error reporting 
00019 //    1 - XCOMMENT, Constructor/Destructor mesages
00020 //    2 - XSVF command names
00021 //    3 - XSVF command parameters and Tap State transitions
00022 //    4 - TDI/TDO shift data (presented up to 16 bytes)
00023 //    5 - TDI/TDO shift data (all data)
00024 //
00025 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00026 #define TRACE_XSVF 0
00027 
00028 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00029 // External functions used by XSVF player:
00030 //
00031 //     ReadXSVF : Read byte from XSVF data stream
00032 //     SetTMS   : Set TMS pin on JTAG port
00033 //     SetTCK   : Set TCK pin on JTAG port
00034 //     SetTDI   : Set TDI pin on JTAG port
00035 //     GetTDO   : Read TDO pin on JTAG port
00036 //     uSleep   : Delay execution (in microseconds)
00037 //
00038 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 #include "xsvfPort.hpp"
00040 
00041 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042 // Debug Facility Macros
00043 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044 
00045 #ifdef TRACE_XSVF
00046 
00047 #define TRACE_DBG(level,...) \
00048     do { \
00049         if ( mTraceLevel >= level ) \
00050         { \
00051             xsvfPrintf(__VA_ARGS__); \
00052         } \
00053     } while(0)
00054 
00055 #define TRACE_ARR(level,pOctetArray) \
00056     do { \
00057         if ( mTraceLevel >= level && (pOctetArray) ) \
00058         { \
00059             xsvfPrintf( (pOctetArray)->len ? "0x" : "<empty>" ); \
00060             int c = (pOctetArray)->len; \
00061             if ( mTraceLevel <= level && c > 16 ) \
00062                 c = 16; \
00063             for ( int i = 0; i < c; ++i ) \
00064             { \
00065                 xsvfPrintf( "%02X", int( (pOctetArray)->val[ i ] ) ); \
00066             } \
00067             if ( (pOctetArray)->len > c ) \
00068                 xsvfPrintf( "..." ); \
00069         } \
00070     } while(0)
00071 
00072 #else // ! TRACE_XSVF
00073 
00074 #define TRACE_DBG(mTraceLevel,...)
00075 #define TRACE_ARR(mTraceLevel,pOctetArray)
00076 
00077 #endif // TRACE_XSVF

00079 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00080 // Type Declarations
00081 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 
00083 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 // The OctetArray structure is a byte oriented type used to store an arbitrary 
00085 // length binary value. As an example, the hex value 0x0e3d is represented as 
00086 // a structure with:
00087 //
00088 //     len = 2  (since 2 bytes) 
00089 //     val[0] = 0e
00090 //     val[1] = 3d  
00091 //     val[2..MAX_LEN] are undefined
00092 //
00093 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094 struct OctetArray
00095 {
00096     enum 
00097     { 
00098         MAX_LEN = 128    // MAX_LEN = ceil( max( XSDRSIZE ) / 8 )
00099         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100         // This MAX_LEN defines the maximum length (in bytes) of predefined
00101         // buffers in which the XSVF player stores the current shift data.
00102         // This length must be greater than the longest shift length (in bytes)
00103         // in the XSVF files that will be processed. 
00104         // 
00105         // How to find the "shift length" in bits?
00106         // Look at the ASCII version of the XSVF (generated with the -a option
00107         // for the SVF2XSVF translator) and search for the XSDRSIZE command
00108         // with the biggest parameter. XSDRSIZE is equivalent to the SVF's
00109         // SDR length plus the lengths of applicable HDR and TDR commands.
00110         // Remember that the MAX_LEN is defined in bytes. Therefore, the
00111         // minimum MAX_LEN = ceil( max( XSDRSIZE ) / 8 );
00112         // 
00113         // The following MAX_LEN values have been tested and provide relatively
00114         // good margin for the corresponding devices:
00115         // 
00116         //  DEVICE        MAX_LEN   Resulting Max Shift Length (in bits)
00117         //  ---------     -------   ----------------------------------------------
00118         //  XC9500/XL/XV       32     256
00119         // 
00120         //  CoolRunner/II     256    2048  - actual max 1 device = 1035 bits
00121         // 
00122         //  FPGA              128    1024  - svf2xsvf -rlen 1024
00123         // 
00124         //  XC18V00/XCF00    1100    8800  - no blank check performed (default)
00125         //                                 - actual max 1 device = 8192 bits verify
00126         //                                 - max 1 device = 4096 bits program-only
00127         //                   2500   20000  - required for blank check
00128         //                                 - blank check max 1 device = 16384 bits
00129         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130         };
00131 
00132     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00133     //      Members
00134     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135 
00136     int len;                           // number of chars in this value
00137     unsigned char val[ MAX_LEN + 1];   // bytes of data
00138 
00139     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140     // Extract the long value from the octet array.
00141     // Returns the extracted value.
00142     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00143     long GetValue( void )
00144     {
00145         long lValue  = 0; // result to hold the accumulated result
00146 
00147         for ( int i = 0; i < len ; ++i )
00148         {
00149             lValue <<= 8;        // shift the accumulated result
00150             lValue |= val[ i];   // get the last byte first
00151             }
00152 
00153         return lValue;
00154         }
00155 
00156     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00157     // Compare two octet arrays with an optional mask.
00158     // Returns: bool; true if equal
00159     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00160     bool IsEqual
00161     ( 
00162         OctetArray* plvVal, // ptr to octet array #2. 
00163         OctetArray* plvMask // optional ptr to mask; NULL if no mask 
00164         )
00165     {
00166         // Start at least significant bit and compare bytes
00167         //
00168         for ( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i-- )
00169         {
00170             int val1 = val[ i ];
00171             int val2 = plvVal->val[ i ];
00172             if ( plvMask )
00173             {
00174                 int mask = plvMask->val[ i ];
00175                 val1 &= mask;
00176                 val2 &= mask;
00177                 }
00178             if ( val1 != val2 )
00179                 return false;
00180             }
00181 
00182         return true;
00183         }
00184 
00185     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00186     // Read from XSVF numBytes bytes of data into.
00187     // Method returns false if premature stream is encountered.
00188     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00189     bool ReadXSVF
00190     (
00191         int numBytes // the number of bytes to read.
00192         )
00193     {
00194         len = numBytes;
00195         for ( int i = 0; i < numBytes; i++ )
00196         {
00197             int ch = ::ReadXSVF ();
00198             if ( ch < 0 )
00199                 return false;
00200             val[ i ] = ch;
00201             }
00202         return true;
00203         }
00204 
00205     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00206     // Add addendum to local octet array
00207     // Assumes *this and addendum octet arrays are of equal length.
00208     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00209     void Add
00210     ( 
00211          OctetArray& addendum
00212          )
00213     {
00214         int carry = 0;
00215 
00216         // Start at least significant bit and add bytes
00217         //
00218         for ( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i-- )
00219         {
00220             // Add the two bytes plus carry from previous addition
00221             int sum = val[ i ] + addendum.val[ i ] + carry;
00222 
00223             // Set the i'th byte of the result
00224             val[ i ] = sum & 0xFF;
00225 
00226             // Set up carry for next byte
00227             carry = sum >> 8;
00228             }
00229         }
00230     };
00231 
00232 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00233 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 // Struct:       XSVF_Class
00235 // Description:  This structure contains all of the data used during the
00236 //               execution of the XSVF. Some data is persistent, predefined
00237 //               information (e.g. lRunTestTime). The bulk of this struct's
00238 //               size is due to the OctetArray structs
00239 //               which contain buffers for the active shift data. The MAX_LEN
00240 //               in OctetArray struct defines the size of these buffers.
00241 //               These buffers must be large enough to store the longest
00242 //               shift data in your XSVF file. For example:
00243 //                   MAX_LEN >= ( longest_shift_data_in_bits / 8 )
00244 //               Because the OctetArray struct dominates the space usage of this
00245 //               struct, the rough size of this struct is:
00246 //                   sizeof( XSVF_Class ) ~= MAX_LEN * 7 (number of OctetArrays)
00247 //               xsvfInitialize() contains initialization code for the data
00248 //               in this struct.
00249 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00250 class XSVF_Class
00251 {
00252     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00253     // Debug Facility
00254     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00255 
00256 #ifdef TRACE_XSVF
00257     int mTraceLevel;
00258     static const char* pzCommandName [];
00259     static const char* pzTapState [];
00260     static const char* pzErrorName [];
00261 #endif // TRACE_XSVF
00262 
00263     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00264     // Private Enumerated Constants
00265     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00266 
00267     enum XSVF_COMMAND // encodings of xsvf instructions
00268     {
00269         XCOMPLETE      =  0,
00270         XTDOMASK       =  1,
00271         XSIR           =  2,
00272         XSDR           =  3,
00273         XRUNTEST       =  4,
00274         XCMDRESERVED5  =  5,
00275         XCMDRESERVED6  =  6,
00276         XREPEAT        =  7,
00277         XSDRSIZE       =  8,
00278         XSDRTDO        =  9,
00279         XSETSDRMASKS   =  10,
00280         XSDRINC        =  11,
00281         XSDRB          =  12,
00282         XSDRC          =  13,
00283         XSDRE          =  14,
00284         XSDRTDOB       =  15,
00285         XSDRTDOC       =  16,
00286         XSDRTDOE       =  17,
00287         XSTATE         =  18,
00288         XENDIR         =  19,
00289         XENDDR         =  20,
00290         XSIR2          =  21,
00291         XCOMMENT       =  22,
00292         XWAIT          =  23,
00293         XLASTCMD       =  24,
00294         };
00295 
00296     enum XSVF_XENDXR // XSVF Command Parameter Values
00297     {
00298         XENDXR_RUNTEST =  0,            // parameter for XENDIR/DR
00299         XENDXR_PAUSE   =  1             // parameter for XENDIR/DR
00300         };

00302     enum XSVF_TAPSTATE // TAP states
00303     {
00304         XTAPSTATE_RESET     = 0x00,
00305         XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST   = 0x01,     // a.k.a. IDLE
00306         XTAPSTATE_SELECTDR  = 0x02,
00307         XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREDR = 0x03,
00308         XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR   = 0x04,
00309         XTAPSTATE_EXIT1DR   = 0x05,
00310         XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR   = 0x06,
00311         XTAPSTATE_EXIT2DR   = 0x07,
00312         XTAPSTATE_UPDATEDR  = 0x08,
00313         XTAPSTATE_IRSTATES  = 0x09,     // All IR states begin here
00314         XTAPSTATE_SELECTIR  = 0x09,
00315         XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREIR = 0x0A,
00316         XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR   = 0x0B,
00317         XTAPSTATE_EXIT1IR   = 0x0C,
00318         XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR   = 0x0D,
00319         XTAPSTATE_EXIT2IR   = 0x0E,
00320         XTAPSTATE_UPDATEIR  = 0x0F,
00321         ///////////////////////////
00322         XTAPSTATE_FIRST     = 0x00,
00323         XTAPSTATE_LAST      = 0x0F
00324         };

00365     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00366     // Utility Functions

00369     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00370     // Method:       GetAsNumBytes
00371     // Description:  Calculate the number of bytes the given number of bits
00372     //               consumes.
00373     // Returns:      the number of bytes to store the number of bits.
00374     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00375     static inline int GetAsNumBytes
00376     (
00377         long lNumBits // the number of bits
00378         )
00379     {
00380         return int( ( lNumBits + 7L ) / 8L );
00381         }
00382 
00383     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00384     // Method:       TmsTransition
00385     // Description:  Apply TMS and transition TAP controller by applying one TCK
00386     //               cycle.
00387     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00388     static inline void TmsTransition
00389     ( 
00390         int sTms // TMS value 
00391         )
00392     {
00393         SetTMS( sTms );
00394         SetTCK( 0 );
00395         SetTCK( 1 );
00396         }

00398     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00399     // Method:       GotoTapState
00400     // Description:  From the current TAP state, go to the named TAP state.
00401     //               A target state of RESET ALWAYS causes TMS reset sequence.
00402     //               All SVF standard stable state paths are supported.
00403     //               All state transitions are supported except for the following
00404     //               which cause an XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE:
00405     //                   - Target==DREXIT2;  Start!=DRPAUSE
00406     //                   - Target==IREXIT2;  Start!=IRPAUSE
00407     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00408     void GotoTapState
00409     (
00410         XSVF_TAPSTATE ucTargetState // New target TAP state
00411         );
00412 
00413     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00414     // Method:       ShiftOnly
00415     // Description:  Assumes that starting TAP state is SHIFT-DR or SHIFT-IR.
00416     //               Shift the given TDI data into the JTAG scan chain.
00417     //               Optionally, save the TDO data shifted out of the scan chain.
00418     //               Last shift cycle is special:  capture last TDO, set last TDI,
00419     //               but does not pulse TCK. Caller must pulse TCK and optionally
00420     //               set TMS=1 to exit shift state.
00421     // Note:         Method is called only within Shift()
00422     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00423     void ShiftOnly
00424     (
00425         long        lNumBits,       // Number of bits to shift.
00426         bool        bTdoCaptured,   // Store captured TDO data
00427         bool        bExitShift      // 1= exit at end of shift; 0= stay in Shift-DR
00428         );
00429 
00430     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00431     // Method:       Shift
00432     // Description:  Goes to the given starting TAP state.
00433     //               Calls ShiftOnly to shift in the given TDI data and
00434     //               optionally capture the TDO data.
00435     //               Compares the TDO captured data against the TDO expected
00436     //               data.
00437     //               If a data mismatch occurs, then executes the exception
00438     //               handling loop upto mMaxRepeat times.
00439     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00440     void Shift
00441     ( 
00442         XSVF_TAPSTATE ucStartState,       // Starting state: Shift-DR or Shift-IR
00443         long          lNumBits,           // Number of bits to shift
00444         XSVF_TAPSTATE ucEndState,         // State in which to end the shift
00445         long          runTestTime,        // Amount of time to wait after the shift
00446         bool          captureTDO = false, // Capture TDO
00447         int           maxRepeat = 0       // Maximum number of retries on TDO mismatch
00448         );
00449 
00450     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00451     // Method:       BasicXSDRTDO
00452     // Description:  Get the XSDRTDO parameters and execute the XSDRTDO command.
00453     //               This is the common function for all XSDRTDO commands.
00454     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00455     void BasicXSDRTDO
00456     (
00457         XSVF_TAPSTATE ucEndState,         // State in which to end the shift
00458         long          runTestTime = 0,    // Maximum xc9500/xl retries
00459         bool          captureTDO = false, // Capture TDO
00460         int           maxRepeat = 0       // Maximum xc9500/xl retries
00461         )
00462     {
00463         if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
00464         {
00465             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
00466             return;
00467             }
00468 
00469         if ( captureTDO )
00470         {
00471             if ( ! lvTdoExpected.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
00472             {
00473                 mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
00474                 return;
00475                 }
00476             }
00477 
00478         Shift
00479         ( 
00480             XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR, mShiftLengthBits, ucEndState, runTestTime, 
00481             captureTDO, maxRepeat 
00482             );
00483         }
00484 
00485     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486     // Method:       DoSDRMasking
00487     //               Method is called within Do_XSDRINC()
00488     // Description:  Update the data value with the next XSDRINC data and address.
00489     // Example:      dataVal=0x01ff, nextData=0xab, addressMask=0x0100,
00490     //               dataMask=0x00ff, should set dataVal to 0x02ab
00491     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00492     void DoSDRMasking( void );

00523     enum XSVF_RC // Error codes for xsvfExecute.
00524     {
00525         XSVF_ERROR_NONE         = 0,
00526         XSVF_ERROR_UNKNOWN      = 1,
00527         XSVF_ERROR_TDOMISMATCH  = 2,
00528         XSVF_ERROR_MAXRETRIES   = 3,  // TDO mismatch after max retries
00529         XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALCMD   = 4,
00530         XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE = 5,
00531         XSVF_ERROR_DATAOVERFLOW = 6,  // Data > OctetArray::MAX_LEN buffer size
00532         XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE    = 7,  // Premature end of file
00533         XSVF_ERROR_LAST         = 8
00534         };

00629 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00630 // Method:       GotoTapState
00631 // Description:  From the current TAP state, go to the named TAP state.
00632 //               A target state of RESET ALWAYS causes TMS reset sequence.
00633 //               All SVF standard stable state paths are supported.
00634 //               All state transitions are supported except for the following
00635 //               which cause an XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE:
00636 //                 - Target == DREXIT2;  Start != DRPAUSE
00637 //                 - Target == IREXIT2;  Start != IRPAUSE
00638 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00639 void XSVF_Class::GotoTapState
00640 (
00641     XSVF_TAPSTATE ucTargetState // New target TAP state
00642     )
00643 {
00644     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
00645 
00646     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_RESET )
00647     {
00648         // If RESET, always perform TMS reset sequence to reset/sync TAPs
00649         //
00650         TmsTransition( 1 );
00651 
00652         for ( int i = 0; i < 5; ++i )
00653         {
00654             SetTCK( 0 );
00655             SetTCK( 1 );
00656             }
00657 
00658         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_RESET;
00659 
00660         TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TMS Reset Sequence -> Test-Logic-Reset\n" );
00661         TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TAP State    = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapState ] );
00662         }
00663     else if ( ucTargetState != mTapState 
00664          && ( ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_EXIT2DR && mTapState != XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR ) 
00665            || ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_EXIT2IR && mTapState != XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR ) ) 
00666         )
00667     {
00668         // Trap illegal TAP state path specification
00669         //
00670         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
00671         }
00672     else
00673     {
00674         if ( ucTargetState == mTapState )
00675         {
00676             // Already in target state. Do nothing except when in DRPAUSE
00677             // or in IRPAUSE to comply with SVF standard
00678             //
00679             if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR )
00680             {
00681                 TmsTransition( 1 );
00682                 mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT2DR;
00683                 TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TAP State    = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapState ] );
00684                 }
00685             else if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR )
00686             {
00687                 TmsTransition( 1 );
00688                 mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT2IR;
00689                 TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TAP State    = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapState ] );
00690                 }
00691             }
00692 
00693         // Perform TAP state transitions to get to the target state
00694         //
00695         while ( ucTargetState != mTapState )
00696         {
00697             switch ( mTapState )
00698             {
00699                 case XTAPSTATE_RESET:
00700                     TmsTransition( 0 );
00701                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
00702                     break;
00703 
00704                 case XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST:
00705                     TmsTransition( 1 );
00706                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SELECTDR;
00707                     break;
00708 
00709                 case XTAPSTATE_SELECTDR:
00710                     if ( ucTargetState >= XTAPSTATE_IRSTATES )
00711                     {
00712                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00713                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SELECTIR;
00714                         }
00715                     else
00716                     {
00717                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00718                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREDR;
00719                         }
00720                     break;
00721 
00722                 case XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREDR:
00723                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR )
00724                     {
00725                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00726                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR;
00727                         }
00728                     else
00729                     {
00730                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00731                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1DR;
00732                         }
00733                     break;
00734 
00735                 case XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR:
00736                     TmsTransition( 1 );
00737                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1DR;
00738                     break;
00739 
00740                 case XTAPSTATE_EXIT1DR:
00741                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR )
00742                     {
00743                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00744                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR;
00745                         }
00746                     else
00747                     {
00748                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00749                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_UPDATEDR;
00750                         }
00751                     break;
00752 
00753                 case XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR:
00754                     TmsTransition( 1 );
00755                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT2DR;
00756                     break;
00757 
00758                 case XTAPSTATE_EXIT2DR:
00759                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR )
00760                     {
00761                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00762                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR;
00763                         }
00764                     else
00765                     {
00766                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00767                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_UPDATEDR;
00768                         }
00769                     break;
00770 
00771                 case XTAPSTATE_UPDATEDR:
00772                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST )
00773                     {
00774                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00775                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
00776                         }
00777                     else
00778                     {
00779                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00780                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SELECTDR;
00781                         }
00782                     break;
00783 
00784                 case XTAPSTATE_SELECTIR:
00785                     TmsTransition( 0 );
00786                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREIR;
00787                     break;
00788 
00789                 case XTAPSTATE_CAPTUREIR:
00790                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR )
00791                     {
00792                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00793                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR;
00794                         }
00795                     else
00796                     {
00797                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00798                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1IR;
00799                         }
00800                     break;
00801 
00802                 case XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR:
00803                     TmsTransition( 1 );
00804                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1IR;
00805                     break;
00806 
00807                 case XTAPSTATE_EXIT1IR:
00808                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR )
00809                     {
00810                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00811                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR;
00812                         }
00813                     else
00814                     {
00815                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00816                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_UPDATEIR;
00817                         }
00818                     break;
00819 
00820                 case XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR:
00821                     TmsTransition( 1 );
00822                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT2IR;
00823                     break;
00824 
00825                 case XTAPSTATE_EXIT2IR:
00826                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR )
00827                     {
00828                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00829                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR;
00830                         }
00831                     else
00832                     {
00833                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00834                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_UPDATEIR;
00835                         }
00836                     break;
00837 
00838                 case XTAPSTATE_UPDATEIR:
00839                     if ( ucTargetState == XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST )
00840                     {
00841                         TmsTransition( 0 );
00842                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
00843                         }
00844                     else
00845                     {
00846                         TmsTransition( 1 );
00847                         mTapState = XTAPSTATE_SELECTDR;
00848                         }
00849                     break;
00850 
00851                 default:
00852                     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
00853                     mTapState = ucTargetState;    // Exit while loop
00854                     break;
00855                 }
00856 
00857             TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TAP State    = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapState ] );
00858             }
00859         }
00860     }
00861 
00862 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00863 // Method:       XSVF_Class::ShiftOnly
00864 //               Method is called only within Shift()
00865 // Description:  Assumes that starting TAP state is SHIFT-DR or SHIFT-IR.
00866 //               Shift the given TDI data into the JTAG scan chain.
00867 //               Optionally, save the TDO data shifted out of the scan chain.
00868 //               Last shift cycle is special:  capture last TDO, set last TDI,
00869 //               but does not pulse TCK. Caller must pulse TCK and optionally
00870 //               set TMS=1 to exit shift state.
00871 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00872 void XSVF_Class::ShiftOnly
00873 (
00874     long        lNumBits,       // Number of bits to shift.
00875     bool        bTdoCaptured,   // Store captured TDO data
00876     bool        bExitShift      // 1= exit at end of shift; 0= stay in Shift-DR
00877     )
00878 {
00879     // assert( ( ( lNumBits + 7 ) / 8 ) == lvTdi.len );
00880 
00881     // Initialize TDO storage len == TDI len
00882     //
00883     unsigned char* pucTdo = 0;
00884     if ( bTdoCaptured )
00885     {
00886         lvTdoCaptured.len = lvTdi.len;
00887         pucTdo            = lvTdoCaptured.val + lvTdi.len;
00888         }
00889 
00890     // Shift LSB first: val[N-1] == LSB, val[0] == MSB
00891     //
00892     unsigned char* pucTdi = lvTdi.val + lvTdi.len;
00893     while ( lNumBits )
00894     {
00895         // Process on a byte-basis
00896         //
00897         int ucTdiByte = *(--pucTdi);
00898         int ucTdoByte = 0;
00899         for ( int i = 0; lNumBits && i < 8; ++i )
00900         {
00901             --lNumBits;
00902             if ( bExitShift && ! lNumBits )
00903             {
00904                 // Exit Shift-DR state
00905                 //
00906                 SetTMS( 1 );
00907                 }
00908 
00909             // Set the new TDI value
00910             //
00911             SetTDI( ucTdiByte & 1 );
00912             ucTdiByte >>= 1;
00913 
00914             // Set TCK low
00915             //
00916             SetTCK( 0 );
00917 
00918             // Save the TDO value
00919             //
00920             if ( pucTdo )
00921             {
00922                 ucTdoByte |= ( GetTDO () << i );
00923                 }
00924 
00925             // Set TCK high
00926             //
00927             SetTCK( 1 );
00928             }
00929 
00930         // Save the TDO byte value
00931         //
00932         if ( pucTdo )
00933         {
00934             *(--pucTdo) = ucTdoByte;
00935             }
00936         }
00937     }
00938 
00939 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00940 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Shift
00941 // Description:  Goes to the given starting TAP state.
00942 //               Calls ShiftOnly to shift in the given TDI data and
00943 //               optionally capture the TDO data.
00944 //               Compares the TDO captured data against the TDO expected
00945 //               data.
00946 //               If a data mismatch occurs, then executes the exception
00947 //               handling loop upto mMaxRepeat times.
00948 // Notes:        XC9500XL-only Optimization:
00949 //               Skip the uSleep() if plvTdoMask->val[0:plvTdoMask->len-1]
00950 //               is NOT all zeros and sMatch==1.
00951 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00952 void XSVF_Class::Shift
00953 ( 
00954     XSVF_TAPSTATE ucStartState,   // Starting shift state: Shift-DR or Shift-IR
00955     long          lNumBits,       // number of bits to shift
00956     XSVF_TAPSTATE ucEndState,     // state in which to end the shift
00957     long          runTestTime,    // amount of time to wait after the shift
00958     bool          captureTDO,     // capture TDO
00959     int           maxRepeat       // Maximum number of retries on TDO mismatch
00960     )
00961 {
00962     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
00963 
00964     if ( ! lNumBits )
00965     {
00966         // Compatibility with XSVF2.00
00967         // XSDR 0 means: "no shift, but wait in run test"
00968         //
00969         if ( runTestTime )
00970         {
00971             // Wait for prespecified XRUNTEST time
00972             //
00973             GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST );
00974             TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Wait         = %ld usec\n", runTestTime );
00975             if ( ! mParseOnly )
00976             {
00977                 uSleep( runTestTime );
00978                 }
00979             }
00980 
00981         return;
00982         }
00983 
00984     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Shift Length = %ld\n", lNumBits );
00985     TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDI          = " );
00986     TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdi );
00987     TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n");
00988 
00989     if ( captureTDO )
00990     {
00991         TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Expected = " );
00992         TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdoExpected );
00993         TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
00994         }
00995 
00996     bool bMismatch = false;
00997 
00998     int retry = 0;
00999     do
01000     {
01001         bool bExitShift = ucStartState != ucEndState;
01002 
01003         // Goto Shift-DR or Shift-IR
01004         //
01005         GotoTapState( ucStartState );
01006 
01007         // Shift TDI and optionally capture TDO
01008         //
01009         if ( ! mParseOnly )
01010         {
01011             ShiftOnly( lNumBits, captureTDO, bExitShift );
01012 
01013             // Compare TDO data to expected TDO data
01014             //
01015             if ( captureTDO )
01016             {
01017                 bMismatch = ! lvTdoCaptured.IsEqual( &lvTdoExpected, &lvTdoMask );
01018                 }
01019             }
01020 
01021         if ( bExitShift )
01022         {
01023             // Update TAP state:  Shift->Exit
01024             //
01025             switch( mTapState )
01026             {
01027                 case XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR: 
01028                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1DR; 
01029                     break;
01030                 case XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR: 
01031                     mTapState = XTAPSTATE_EXIT1IR; 
01032                     break;
01033                 default:
01034                     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
01035                     return;
01036                 }
01037 
01038             TRACE_DBG( 3, "      TAP State    = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapState ] );
01039 
01040             if ( bMismatch && runTestTime && retry < maxRepeat )
01041             {
01042                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Mismatch\n" );
01043                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Captured = " );
01044                 TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdoCaptured );
01045                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01046                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Expected = " );
01047                 TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdoExpected );
01048                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01049                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Mask     = " );
01050                 TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdoMask );
01051                 TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01052 
01053                 // Do exception handling retry - ShiftDR only
01054                 //
01055                 GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR );
01056 
01057                 // Shift 1 extra bit
01058                 //
01059                 GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR );
01060 
01061                 // Increment RUNTEST time by an additional 25%
01062                 //
01063                 runTestTime += ( runTestTime >> 2 );
01064                 }
01065             else
01066             {
01067                 // Do normal exit from Shift-XR
01068                 //
01069                 GotoTapState( ucEndState );
01070                 }
01071 
01072             if ( runTestTime )
01073             {
01074                 // Wait for prespecified XRUNTEST time
01075                 //
01076                 GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST );
01077                 TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Wait         = %ld usec\n", runTestTime );
01078                 if ( ! mParseOnly )
01079                 {
01080                     uSleep( runTestTime );
01081                     }
01082                 }
01083 
01084             if ( bMismatch && retry < maxRepeat )
01085             {
01086                 TRACE_DBG( 3, "----> RETRY        # %d\n", retry + 1 );
01087                 }
01088             }
01089         } while( bMismatch && retry++ < maxRepeat );
01090 
01091     if ( bMismatch )
01092     {
01093         if ( maxRepeat && retry > maxRepeat )
01094             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_MAXRETRIES;
01095         else
01096             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_TDOMISMATCH;
01097         }
01098     }
01099 
01100 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01101 // Method:       XSVF_Class::DoSDRMasking
01102 //               Method is called only within Do_XSDRINC()
01103 // Description:  Update the data value with the next XSDRINC data and address.
01104 // Example:      dataVal=0x01ff, nextData=0xab, addressMask=0x0100,
01105 //               dataMask=0x00ff, should set dataVal to 0x02ab
01106 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01107 void XSVF_Class::DoSDRMasking( void )
01108 {
01109     // Add the address Mask to dataVal and return as a new dataVal
01110     //
01111     lvTdi.Add( lvAddressMask );
01112 
01113     int ucNextData = 0;
01114     int ucNextMask = 0;
01115     int sNextData  = lvNextData.len;
01116 
01117     for ( int i = lvDataMask.len - 1; i >= 0; --i )
01118     {
01119         // Go through data mask in reverse order looking for mask (1) bits
01120         //
01121         int ucDataMask = lvDataMask.val[ i ];
01122         if ( ucDataMask )
01123         {
01124             // Retrieve the corresponding TDI byte value
01125             //
01126             int ucTdi = lvTdi.val[ i ];
01127 
01128             // For each bit in the data mask byte, look for 1's
01129             //
01130             int ucTdiMask = 1;
01131             while ( ucDataMask )
01132             {
01133                 if ( ucDataMask & 1 )
01134                 {
01135                     if ( ! ucNextMask )
01136                     {
01137                         // Get the next data byte
01138                         //
01139                         ucNextData = lvNextData.val[ --sNextData ];
01140                         ucNextMask = 1;
01141                         }
01142 
01143                     // Set or clear the data bit according to the next data
01144                     //
01145                     if ( ucNextData & ucNextMask )
01146                     {
01147                         ucTdi |= ucTdiMask; // Set bit
01148                         }
01149                     else
01150                     {
01151                         ucTdi &= ~ucTdiMask; // Clear bit
01152                         }
01153 
01154                     // Update the next data
01155                     //
01156                     ucNextMask  <<= 1;
01157                     }
01158 
01159                 ucTdiMask  <<= 1;
01160                 ucDataMask >>= 1;
01161                 }
01162 
01163             // Update the TDI value
01164             //
01165             lvTdi.val[ i ] = ucTdi;
01166             }
01167         }
01168     }
01169 
01170 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01171 // XSVF_Class XSVF Command Functions
01172 // These functions update mErrorCode on an error.
01173 // Otherwise, the error code is left alone.
01174 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01175 
01176 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01177 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_ILLEGALCMD
01178 // Description:  Function place holder for illegal/unsupported commands.
01179 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01180 void XSVF_Class::Do_ILLEGALCMD( void )
01181 {
01182     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALCMD;
01183     }
01184 
01185 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01186 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XCOMPLETE
01187 // Description:  XCOMPLETE (no parameters)
01188 //               Update complete status for XSVF player.
01189 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01190 void XSVF_Class::Do_XCOMPLETE( void )
01191 {
01192     mComplete = true;
01193     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01194     }
01195 
01196 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01197 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XTDOMASK
01198 // Description:  XTDOMASK <OctetArray.TdoMask[XSDRSIZE]>
01199 //               Prespecify the TDO compare mask.
01200 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01201 void XSVF_Class::Do_XTDOMASK( void )
01202 {
01203     if ( ! lvTdoMask.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
01204     {
01205         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01206         return;
01207         }
01208 
01209     TRACE_DBG( 4, "      TDO Mask     = ");
01210     TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvTdoMask );
01211     TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n");
01212 
01213     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01214     }
01215 
01216 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01217 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSIR
01218 // Description:  XSIR <(byte)shiftlen> <OctetArray.TDI[shiftlen]>
01219 //               Get the instruction and shift the instruction into the TAP.
01220 //               If prespecified XRUNTEST!=0, goto RUNTEST and wait after
01221 //               the shift for XRUNTEST usec.
01222 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01223 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSIR( void )
01224 {
01225     // Get the shift length and store
01226     //
01227     int ucShiftIrBits = ReadXSVF ();
01228     if ( ucShiftIrBits < 0 )
01229     {
01230         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01231         return;
01232         }
01233         
01234     int sShiftIrBytes = GetAsNumBytes( ucShiftIrBits );
01235     if ( sShiftIrBytes < 0 )
01236     {
01237         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01238         return;
01239         }
01240         
01241     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      IR Length    = %d\n", ucShiftIrBits );
01242 
01243     if ( sShiftIrBytes > OctetArray::MAX_LEN )
01244     {
01245         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_DATAOVERFLOW;
01246         return;
01247         }
01248 
01249     // Get and store instruction to shift in
01250     //
01251     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( GetAsNumBytes( ucShiftIrBits ) ) )
01252     {
01253         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01254         return;
01255         }
01256 
01257     // Shift the data
01258     //
01259     Shift( XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR, ucShiftIrBits, mTapStateEndIR, mRunTestTime );
01260     }
01261 
01262 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01263 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSIR2
01264 // Description:  XSIR <(2-byte)shiftlen> <OctetArray.TDI[shiftlen]>
01265 //               Get the instruction and shift the instruction into the TAP.
01266 //               If prespecified XRUNTEST!=0, goto RUNTEST and wait after
01267 //               the shift for XRUNTEST usec.
01268 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01269 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSIR2( void )
01270 {
01271     // Get the shift length and store
01272     //
01273     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 2 ) )
01274     {
01275         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01276         return;
01277         }
01278         
01279     long lShiftIrBits  = lvTdi.GetValue ();
01280     int sShiftIrBytes  = GetAsNumBytes( lShiftIrBits );
01281 
01282     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      IR Length    = %ld\n", lShiftIrBits);
01283 
01284     if ( sShiftIrBytes > OctetArray::MAX_LEN )
01285     {
01286         mErrorCode  = XSVF_ERROR_DATAOVERFLOW;
01287         }
01288     else
01289     {
01290         // Get and store instruction to shift in
01291         //
01292         if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( GetAsNumBytes( lShiftIrBits ) ) )
01293         {
01294             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01295             return;
01296             }
01297 
01298         // Shift the data
01299         //
01300         Shift( XTAPSTATE_SHIFTIR, lShiftIrBits, mTapStateEndIR, mRunTestTime );
01301         }
01302     }
01303 
01304 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01305 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDR
01306 // Description:  XSDR <OctetArray.TDI[XSDRSIZE]>
01307 //               Shift the given TDI data into the JTAG scan chain.
01308 //               Compare the captured TDO with the expected TDO from the
01309 //               previous XSDRTDO command using the previously specified
01310 //               XTDOMASK.
01311 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01312 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDR( void )
01313 {
01314     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
01315     {
01316         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01317         return;
01318         }
01319 
01320     // Use TDOExpected from last XSDRTDO instruction
01321     //
01322     Shift
01323     ( 
01324         XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR, mShiftLengthBits, mTapStateEndDR, mRunTestTime,
01325         /*captureTDO*/true, mMaxRepeat 
01326         );
01327     }
01328 
01329 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01330 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XRUNTEST
01331 // Description:  XRUNTEST <uint32>
01332 //               Prespecify the XRUNTEST wait time for shift operations.
01333 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01334 void XSVF_Class::Do_XRUNTEST( void )
01335 {
01336     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 4 ) )
01337     {
01338         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01339         return;
01340         }
01341 
01342     mRunTestTime = lvTdi.GetValue ();
01343 
01344     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Test Time    = %ld usec\n", mRunTestTime );
01345 
01346     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01347     }
01348 
01349 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01350 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XREPEAT
01351 // Description:  XREPEAT <byte>
01352 //               Prespecify the maximum number of XC9500/XL retries.
01353 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01354 void XSVF_Class::Do_XREPEAT( void )
01355 {
01356     mMaxRepeat = ReadXSVF ();
01357     if ( mMaxRepeat < 0 )
01358     {
01359         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01360         return;
01361         }
01362 
01363     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Max Repeat   = %d\n", mMaxRepeat );
01364 
01365     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01366     }
01367 
01368 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01369 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRSIZE
01370 // Description:  XSDRSIZE <uint32>
01371 //               Prespecify the XRUNTEST wait time for shift operations.
01372 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01373 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRSIZE( void )
01374 {
01375     mErrorCode  = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01376 
01377     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 4 ) )
01378     {
01379         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01380         return;
01381         }
01382         
01383     mShiftLengthBits  = lvTdi.GetValue ();
01384     mShiftLengthBytes = GetAsNumBytes( mShiftLengthBits );
01385 
01386     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      DR Size      = %ld\n", mShiftLengthBits );
01387 
01388     if ( mShiftLengthBytes > OctetArray::MAX_LEN )
01389     {
01390         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_DATAOVERFLOW;
01391         }
01392     }
01393 
01394 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01395 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRTDO
01396 // Description:  XSDRTDO <OctetArray.TDI[XSDRSIZE]> <OctetArray.TDO[XSDRSIZE]>
01397 //               Get the TDI and expected TDO values. Then, shift.
01398 //               Compare the expected TDO with the captured TDO using the
01399 //               prespecified XTDOMASK.
01400 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01401 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRTDO( void )
01402 {
01403     BasicXSDRTDO( mTapStateEndDR, mRunTestTime, /*captureTDO=*/ true, mMaxRepeat );
01404     }
01405 
01406 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01407 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSETSDRMASKS
01408 // Description:  XSETSDRMASKS <OctetArray.AddressMask[XSDRSIZE]>
01409 //                            <OctetArray.DataMask[XSDRSIZE]>
01410 //               Get the prespecified address and data mask for the XSDRINC
01411 //               command.
01412 //               Used for xc9500/xl compressed XSVF data.
01413 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01414 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSETSDRMASKS( void )
01415 {
01416     // Read the addressMask
01417     //
01418     if ( ! lvAddressMask.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
01419     {
01420         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01421         return;
01422         }
01423 
01424     // Read the dataMask
01425     //
01426     if ( ! lvDataMask.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
01427     {
01428         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01429         return;
01430         }
01431 
01432     TRACE_DBG( 4, "       Addr Mask   = " );
01433     TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvAddressMask );
01434     TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01435     TRACE_DBG( 4, "       Data Mask   = " );
01436     TRACE_ARR( 4, &lvDataMask );
01437     TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01438 
01439     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01440     }
01441 
01442 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01443 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRINC
01444 // Description:  XSDRINC <OctetArray.firstTDI[XSDRSIZE]> <byte(numTimes)>
01445 //                       <OctetArray.data[XSETSDRMASKS.dataMask.len]> ...
01446 //               Get the XSDRINC parameters and execute the XSDRINC command.
01447 //               XSDRINC starts by loading the first TDI shift value.
01448 //               Then, for numTimes, XSDRINC gets the next piece of data,
01449 //               replaces the bits from the starting TDI as defined by the
01450 //               XSETSDRMASKS.dataMask, adds the address mask from
01451 //               XSETSDRMASKS.addressMask, shifts the new TDI value,
01452 //               and compares the TDO to the expected TDO from the previous
01453 //               XSDRTDO command using the XTDOMASK.
01454 //               Used for xc9500/xl compressed XSVF data.
01455 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01456 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRINC( void )
01457 {
01458     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( mShiftLengthBytes ) )
01459     {
01460         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01461         return;
01462         }
01463 
01464     Shift
01465     ( 
01466         XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR, mShiftLengthBits, mTapStateEndDR, mRunTestTime, 
01467         /*captureTDO=*/true, mMaxRepeat 
01468         );
01469 
01470     if ( ! mErrorCode )
01471     {
01472         // Calculate number of data mask bits
01473         //
01474         int iDataMaskLen = 0;
01475         for ( int i = 0; i < lvDataMask.len; ++i )
01476         {
01477             for( int ucDataMask  = lvDataMask.val[ i ]; ucDataMask; ucDataMask >>= 1 )
01478             {
01479                 iDataMaskLen += ( ucDataMask & 1 );
01480                 }
01481             }
01482 
01483         // Get the number of data pieces, i.e. number of times to shift
01484         //
01485         int ucNumTimes = ReadXSVF ();
01486         if ( ucNumTimes < 0 )
01487         {
01488             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01489             return;
01490             }
01491 
01492         // For numTimes, get data, fix TDI, and shift
01493         //
01494         for ( int i = 0; ! mErrorCode && i < ucNumTimes; ++i )
01495         {
01496             if ( ! lvNextData.ReadXSVF( GetAsNumBytes( iDataMaskLen ) ) )
01497             {
01498                 mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01499                 return;
01500                 }
01501 
01502             DoSDRMasking ();
01503 
01504             Shift
01505             (
01506                 XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR, mShiftLengthBits, mTapStateEndDR, mRunTestTime, 
01507                 /*captureTDO=*/ true, mMaxRepeat
01508                 );
01509             }
01510         }
01511     }
01512 
01513 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01514 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRBCE
01515 // Description:  XSDRB/XSDRC/XSDRE <OctetArray.TDI[XSDRSIZE]>
01516 //               If not already in SHIFTDR, goto SHIFTDR.
01517 //               Shift the given TDI data into the JTAG scan chain.
01518 //               Ignore TDO.
01519 //               If cmd==XSDRE, then goto ENDDR. Otherwise, stay in ShiftDR.
01520 //               XSDRB, XSDRC, and XSDRE are the same implementation.
01521 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01522 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRBCE( void )
01523 {
01524     BasicXSDRTDO( mCommand == XSDRE ? mTapStateEndDR : XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR );
01525     }
01526 
01527 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01528 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRTDOBCE
01529 // Description:  XSDRB/XSDRC/XSDRE <OctetArray.TDI[XSDRSIZE]> <OctetArray.TDO[XSDRSIZE]>
01530 //               If not already in SHIFTDR, goto SHIFTDR.
01531 //               Shift the given TDI data into the JTAG scan chain.
01532 //               Compare TDO, but do NOT use XTDOMASK.
01533 //               If cmd==XSDRTDOE, then goto ENDDR. Otherwise, stay in ShiftDR.
01534 //               XSDRTDOB, XSDRTDOC, and XSDRTDOE are the same implementation.
01535 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01536 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSDRTDOBCE( void )
01537 {
01538     BasicXSDRTDO( mCommand == XSDRTDOE ? mTapStateEndDR : XTAPSTATE_SHIFTDR );
01539     }
01540 
01541 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01542 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XSTATE
01543 // Description:  XSTATE <byte>
01544 //               <byte> == XTAPSTATE;
01545 //               Get the state parameter and transition the TAP to that state.
01546 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01547 void XSVF_Class::Do_XSTATE( void )
01548 {
01549     int ucNextState = ReadXSVF ();
01550     if ( ucNextState < 0 )
01551     {
01552         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01553         return;
01554         }
01555 
01556     if ( ucNextState < XTAPSTATE_FIRST || ucNextState > XTAPSTATE_LAST )
01557     {
01558         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
01559         return;
01560         }
01561 
01562     GotoTapState( XSVF_TAPSTATE( ucNextState ) );
01563     }
01564 
01565 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01566 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XENDXR
01567 // Description:  XENDIR/XENDDR <byte>
01568 //               <byte>:  0 = RUNTEST;  1 = PAUSE.
01569 //               Get the prespecified XENDIR or XENDDR.
01570 //               Both XENDIR and XENDDR use the same implementation.
01571 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01572 void XSVF_Class::Do_XENDXR( void )
01573 {
01574     mErrorCode  = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01575 
01576     int ucEndState = ReadXSVF ();
01577     if ( ucEndState < 0 )
01578     {
01579         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01580         return;
01581         }
01582 
01583     if ( ucEndState != XENDXR_RUNTEST && ucEndState != XENDXR_PAUSE )
01584     {
01585         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
01586         }
01587     else
01588     {
01589         if ( mCommand == XENDIR )
01590         {
01591             if ( ucEndState == XENDXR_RUNTEST )
01592             {
01593                 mTapStateEndIR = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
01594                 }
01595             else
01596             {
01597                 mTapStateEndIR = XTAPSTATE_PAUSEIR;
01598                 }
01599 
01600             TRACE_DBG( 3, "      End IR State = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapStateEndIR ] );
01601             }
01602         else // XENDDR 
01603         {
01604             if ( ucEndState == XENDXR_RUNTEST )
01605             {
01606                 mTapStateEndDR = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
01607                 }
01608             else
01609             {
01610                 mTapStateEndDR = XTAPSTATE_PAUSEDR;
01611                 }
01612 
01613             TRACE_DBG( 3, "      End DR State = %s\n", pzTapState[ mTapStateEndDR ] );
01614             }
01615         }
01616     }
01617 
01618 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01619 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XCOMMENT
01620 // Description:  XCOMMENT <text string ending in \0>
01621 //               <text string ending in \0> == text comment;
01622 //               Arbitrary comment embedded in the XSVF.
01623 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01624 void XSVF_Class::Do_XCOMMENT( void )
01625 {
01626     // Read through the comment to the end '\0' and display message.
01627     //
01628     TRACE_DBG( 1, "      " );
01629 
01630     for( ;; )
01631     {
01632         int ucText = ReadXSVF ();
01633         if ( ucText < 0 )
01634         {
01635             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01636             return;
01637             }
01638 
01639         if ( ucText == 0 )
01640         {
01641             TRACE_DBG( 1, "\n" );
01642             break;
01643             }
01644         else
01645         {
01646             TRACE_DBG( 1, "%c", ucText );
01647             }
01648         }
01649 
01650     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01651     }
01652 
01653 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01654 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Do_XWAIT
01655 // Description:  XWAIT <wait_state> <end_state> <wait_time>
01656 //               If not already in <wait_state>, then go to <wait_state>.
01657 //               Wait in <wait_state> for <wait_time> microseconds.
01658 //               Finally, if not already in <end_state>, then goto <end_state>.
01659 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01660 void XSVF_Class::Do_XWAIT( void )
01661 {
01662     // Get Parameters
01663     // <wait_state>
01664     //
01665     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 1 ) )
01666     {
01667         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01668         return;
01669         }
01670 
01671     int ucWaitState = lvTdi.val[0];
01672     if ( ucWaitState < XTAPSTATE_FIRST || ucWaitState > XTAPSTATE_LAST )
01673     {
01674         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
01675         return;
01676         }
01677 
01678     // <end_state>
01679     //
01680     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 1 ) )
01681     {
01682         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01683         return;
01684         }
01685 
01686     int ucEndState = lvTdi.val[0];
01687     if ( ucEndState < XTAPSTATE_FIRST || ucEndState > XTAPSTATE_LAST )
01688     {
01689         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALSTATE;
01690         return;
01691         }
01692 
01693     // <wait_time>
01694     //
01695     if ( ! lvTdi.ReadXSVF( 4 ) )
01696     {
01697         mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01698         return;
01699         }
01700 
01701     long lWaitTime = lvTdi.GetValue ();
01702 
01703     TRACE_DBG( 3, "      Wait / State = %s, Time = %ld usec\n", 
01704                pzTapState[ ucWaitState ], lWaitTime );
01705 
01706     // If not already in <wait_state>, go to <wait_state>
01707     //
01708     if ( mTapState != ucWaitState )
01709     {
01710         GotoTapState( XSVF_TAPSTATE( ucWaitState ) );
01711         }
01712 
01713     // Wait for <wait_time> microseconds
01714     //
01715     if ( ! mParseOnly )
01716     {
01717         uSleep( lWaitTime );
01718         }
01719 
01720     // If not already in <end_state>, go to <end_state>
01721     //
01722     if ( mTapState != ucEndState )
01723     {
01724         GotoTapState( XSVF_TAPSTATE( ucEndState ) );
01725         }
01726 
01727     mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01728     }

01731 // Execution Control XSVF_Class Methods
01732 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01733 
01734 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01735 // Method:       XSVF_Class Object Constructor
01736 // Description:  Initialize the xsvf player.
01737 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01738 XSVF_Class::XSVF_Class( void )
01739 {
01740 #ifdef TRACE_XSVF
01741     mTraceLevel = TRACE_XSVF;
01742 #endif
01743 
01744     TRACE_DBG( 1, "XSVF_Class: sizeof() = %d bytes\n", sizeof( XSVF_Class ) );
01745     }
01746 
01747 void XSVF_Class::Initialize( int traceLevel, bool parseOnly )
01748 {
01749     mTraceLevel       = traceLevel;
01750     mParseOnly        = parseOnly;
01751         
01752     TRACE_DBG( 1, "\nXSVF_Class: Initialize: Verbose=%d%s\n", 
01753                   mTraceLevel, mParseOnly ? ", Parse Only" : "" );
01754 
01755     mComplete         = false;
01756     mCommand          = XCOMPLETE;
01757     mCommandCount     = 0;
01758     mErrorCode        = XSVF_ERROR_NONE;
01759     
01760     mTapState         = XTAPSTATE_RESET;
01761     mTapStateEndIR    = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
01762     mTapStateEndDR    = XTAPSTATE_RUNTEST;
01763 
01764     mMaxRepeat        = 0;
01765     mRunTestTime      = 0L;
01766     
01767     mShiftLengthBits  = 0L;
01768     mShiftLengthBytes = 0;
01769     
01770     lvTdi.len         = 0;
01771     lvTdoExpected.len = 0;
01772     lvTdoCaptured.len = 0;
01773     lvTdoMask.len     = 0;
01774     lvAddressMask.len = 0;
01775     lvDataMask.len    = 0;
01776     lvNextData.len    = 0;
01777 
01778     // Initialize the TAPs
01779     //
01780     GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_RESET );
01781     }
01782 
01783 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01784 // Method:       XSVF_Class::_Class Destructor
01785 // Description:  Cleanup remnants of the xsvf player.
01786 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01787 //XSVF_Class::~XSVF_Class( void )
01788 //{
01789 //    }
01790 
01791 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01792 // Method:       XSVF_Class::Run
01793 // Description:  Run the xsvf player commands in loop and return if completed
01794 //               or error encountered.
01795 //               First call Initialize, then call this function.
01796 // Returns:      0 = success; otherwise error.
01797 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01798 int XSVF_Class::Run( void )
01799 {
01800     // Process the XSVF commands
01801     //
01802     while( ! mErrorCode && ! mComplete )
01803     {
01804         // Read 1 byte for the instruction
01805         //
01806         mCommand = ReadXSVF ();
01807         if ( mCommand < 0 )
01808         {
01809             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ENDOFFILE;
01810             break;
01811             }
01812         if ( mCommand >= XLASTCMD )
01813         {
01814             mErrorCode = XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALCMD;
01815             break;
01816             }
01817 
01818         ++mCommandCount;
01819 
01820         TRACE_DBG( 4, "\n" );
01821         TRACE_DBG( 2, "%04ld: %s\n", mCommandCount, pzCommandName[ mCommand ] );
01822 
01823         // Execute the command. Func sets error code.
01824         //
01825         switch( mCommand )
01826         {
01827             case XCOMPLETE      : Do_XCOMPLETE   (); break;
01828             case XTDOMASK       : Do_XTDOMASK    (); break;
01829             case XSIR           : Do_XSIR        (); break;
01830             case XSDR           : Do_XSDR        (); break;
01831             case XRUNTEST       : Do_XRUNTEST    (); break;
01832             case XCMDRESERVED5  : Do_ILLEGALCMD  (); break;
01833             case XCMDRESERVED6  : Do_ILLEGALCMD  (); break;
01834             case XREPEAT        : Do_XREPEAT     (); break;
01835             case XSDRSIZE       : Do_XSDRSIZE    (); break;
01836             case XSDRTDO        : Do_XSDRTDO     (); break;
01837             case XSETSDRMASKS   : Do_XSETSDRMASKS(); break;
01838             case XSDRINC        : Do_XSDRINC     (); break;
01839             case XSDRB          : Do_XSDRBCE     (); break;
01840             case XSDRC          : Do_XSDRBCE     (); break;
01841             case XSDRE          : Do_XSDRBCE     (); break;
01842             case XSDRTDOB       : Do_XSDRTDOBCE  (); break;
01843             case XSDRTDOC       : Do_XSDRTDOBCE  (); break;
01844             case XSDRTDOE       : Do_XSDRTDOBCE  (); break;
01845             case XSTATE         : Do_XSTATE      (); break;
01846             case XENDIR         : Do_XENDXR      (); break;
01847             case XENDDR         : Do_XENDXR      (); break;
01848             case XSIR2          : Do_XSIR2       (); break;
01849             case XCOMMENT       : Do_XCOMMENT    (); break;
01850             case XWAIT          : Do_XWAIT       (); break;
01851             default             : Do_ILLEGALCMD  (); break;
01852         }
01853     }
01854 
01855     if ( mErrorCode )
01856     {
01857         TRACE_DBG( 0, "\nERROR: %s; Near XSVF ASCII File Line #%ld\n",
01858             pzErrorName[ mErrorCode < XSVF_ERROR_LAST ? mErrorCode : XSVF_ERROR_UNKNOWN ],
01859             mCommandCount
01860             );
01861 
01862         if ( mErrorCode == XSVF_ERROR_ILLEGALCMD )
01863         {
01864             TRACE_DBG( 0, 
01865                 "Encountered unsupported command 0x%02X (%s)\n", 
01866                 mCommand,
01867                 mCommand >= 0 && mCommand < XLASTCMD 
01868                     ? pzCommandName[ mCommand ] : "Unknown"
01869                 );
01870             }
01871         else if ( mErrorCode == XSVF_ERROR_MAXRETRIES 
01872                || mErrorCode == XSVF_ERROR_TDOMISMATCH )
01873         {
01874             TRACE_DBG( 0, "TDO Captured = " );
01875             TRACE_ARR( 0, &lvTdoCaptured );
01876             TRACE_DBG( 0, "\n" );
01877             TRACE_DBG( 0, "TDO Expected = " );
01878             TRACE_ARR( 0, &lvTdoExpected );
01879             TRACE_DBG( 0, "\n" );
01880             TRACE_DBG( 0, "TDO Mask     = " );
01881             TRACE_ARR( 0, &lvTdoMask );
01882             TRACE_DBG( 0, "\n" );
01883             }
01884 
01885         // Initialize the TAPs
01886         //
01887         TRACE_DBG( 3, "\n" );
01888         int rc = mErrorCode; // Remember error code
01889         GotoTapState( XTAPSTATE_RESET );
01890         mErrorCode = rc; // Restore error code
01891         }
01892     else
01893     {
01894         TRACE_DBG( 0, "\nSUCCESS: Completed XSVF execution (%ld commands).\n",
01895                       mCommandCount );
01896         }
01897 
01898     TRACE_DBG( 0, "\n" );
01899 
01900     return mErrorCode;
01901     }
01902 
01903 static XSVF_Class xsvfObj;
01904 
01905 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01906 // xsvfExecute() - The primary entry point to the XSVF player
01907 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01908 int xsvfExecute( int traceLevel, bool parseOnly )
01909 {
01910     xsvfObj.Initialize( traceLevel, parseOnly );
01911     return xsvfObj.Run ();
01912     }
